com.pb.sawdust.tabledata

Interface TableKey<K>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - The type of the table key.
    All Superinterfaces:
    TableIndex<K>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTableKey, BasicTableKey, FrozenTableKey

    public interface TableKey<K>
extends TableIndex<K>

    A TableKey object is a specialized TableIndex which maps a single column's values uniquely to a data table's rows. Specifically, for every row in the data table, there will be only one index column value, which itself maps uniquely to the data row. Thus, the number of unique key values in a table key will always be equal to the number of rows in the data table.

    A table key is generified by a key type paramter K. This key type, if declared, must correspond to the object correspondence of the data type of the key column. That is, if key is a TableKey<K> instance, K must be the class reference corresponding to getKeyColumnType().getObjectClass().

    Extending the TableIndex interface leverages that interface's specification as well as its use in data tables, however, it is emphasized that this interface describes a more restrictive version of a table index, and as such should be more efficient. To help fully realize efficiency gains, though, the methods described in this interface have been set up to replace methods in TableIndex, and should be used in place of them whenever possible.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.TableIndex

        getIndexColumnLabels, getIndexCount, getRowNumbers, getUniqueValues

    • Method Detail

      • getKeyColumnLabel

        java.lang.String getKeyColumnLabel()
        Get the label of the column which this key refers to. This method should replace calls to TableIndex.getIndexColumnLabels().
        Returns:
        this key's column label.

      • getKeyColumnType

        DataType getKeyColumnType()
        Get the data type of the column which this key refers to.
        Returns:
        the data type of this key's column.

      • getRowNumber

        int getRowNumber(K keyValue)
        Get the row number corresponding to a given key value. If no row corresponds to the key value, an exception is thrown. This method should replace calls to TableIndex.getRowNumbers(Object[]).
        Parameters:
        keyValue - The index column value.
        Returns:
        the row number whose key column contains indexValue.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if keyValue is of the wrong type, or no row has a key column value matching keyValue.

      • getKey

        K getKey(int rowNumber)
        Get the key corresponding to a given row number.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - The row number.
        Returns:
        the key value corresponding to rowNumber.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if rowNumber is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in its data table.

      • getUniqueKeys

        K[] getUniqueKeys()
        Get the unique index column values for this key. This method should replace calls to TableIndex.getUniqueValues().
        Returns:
        an array of this key's unique key column values.

      • buildIndex

        void buildIndex()
        Build the key (index) as described in TableIndex.buildIndex(). If the building the key results in more than one row being mapped to a single key column value, then an exception will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        buildIndex in interface TableIndex<K>
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if more than one row number maps to a single key column value.
